title: Arkhom Chenglai
text:
Arkhom Chenglai (; ; born June 11, 1970) is a Thai <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. At the <a href="1992%20Summer%20Olympics">1992 Summer Olympics</a> he won a bronze medal in the men's Welterweight category, together with <a href="An%C3%ADbal%20Santiago%20Acevedo">Aníbal Acevedo</a> of Puerto Rico.
Arkhom before an amateur boxer. Formerly he was <a href="Muay%20Thai">Muay Thai</a> fighter <a href="Ring%20name">named</a> Issara Sakgreerin (อิสระ ศักดิ์กรีรินทร์). He started Muay Thai from the habit of playing football. But one day, he went to a shelter from the rain at a Muay Thai gym. And see his brother training, so start training and became a fighter since then.
Later, he became a famous fighter. he won the <a href="Lumpinee%20Stadium">Lumpinee Stadium</a> <a href="Lightweight">Lightweight</a> title, he have a fight with many famous fighters such as <a href="Nokweed%20Devy">Nokweed Devy</a> and he won a maximum salary of 120,000 <a href="Thai%20baht">baht</a> in the fight against the Dutch fighter <a href="Ramon%20Dekkers">Ramon Dekkers</a> at Lumpinee Stadium on November 11, 1990.
He fights until no one is worthy of a bout for him. As a result, he changed to amateur boxing and there are many awards recognized in the country. Before being a national team athlete to compete in the 1992 Summer Olympics in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, Spain until won the bronze medal.
He graduated from Wichienmatu School and earned a bachelor's degree from Chandrakasem Rajabhat College (currently <a href="Chandrakasem%20Rajabhat%20University">Chandrakasem Rajabhat University</a>).
After retirement, he owned a restaurant in Trang province his native.
